result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie M McBride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,310.00 payable to Jose M., Cash bail applied.

Provide a DNA sample; pay the related surcharge. Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments. CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT to go towards restitution. Any remaining restitution, court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 07-01-16 and to continue on the first of each month thereafter; non-payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

07-05-16 / Judge Dennis R Cimpl
The defendant's request for release privilegs is granted.
Defendant may be released for the following: DAY REPORTING CENTER.
First 6 months STRAIGHT TIME and last 6 months with work release privileges
**07-18-16/Order amending JOC to reflect a total of 22 days of sentence credit.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

EXCERPT OF HEARING Transcript commencing MARTCH 14, 2016 received and filed.  Original transcript in case file 16CF864 (13 Pages).

Defendant Willie M McBride in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Willie M McBride in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections, first 6 months straight time and last 6 months with work release privileges, 23 days time served.  

-Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $1,310.00 payable Jose M.  
-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge 
-Cash bail on deposit to go towards restitution.  Any remaining restitution, Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing July 1, 2016 and to continue on the first of each month thereafter; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi in court, defendant Willie M McBride not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a new case, 16CF964.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Court REMANDS defendant into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

and Restitution Worksheet, filed.

Defendant Willie M McBride in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  
Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defense no longer in contest posture.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state; two uncharged read-in offenses set forth on the record.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Elements sheet received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

COUNTS 2, 3, AND UNCHARGED READ-IN OFFENSES:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and state's motion, the Court orders the aforementioned DISMISSED AND READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in Count 1.

The Court orders dna sample be submitted.  Case adjourned before Branch 19.

Defendant Willie M McBride in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  
Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Case called to check the status of this matter.  State's essential witness not present (on vacation).  State's motion to adjourn heard and granted by the Court.  The state and defense engaged in negotiations.  Case passed until 1:30 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie M McBride in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patrick Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Matthew Davis. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
